content:
• Thursday, March 28, 2013
  • OCRX

    Tranzyme (TZYM): Q4 EPS of -$0.18 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $1.61M beats by $0.91M. Shares...

    Tranzyme (TZYM): Q4 EPS of -$0.18 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $1.61M beats by $0.91M. Shares -7.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • LODE

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: LODE +3.8%. CWH +2.5%. VRNG +1.9%. EBR +1.8%. ZOLT...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: LODE +3.8%. CWH +2.5%. VRNG +1.9%. EBR +1.8%. ZOLT +1.7%.
    After-hours top losers: RRMS -3.3%. SPIL -3.2%. OREX -1.7%. NUGT -1.4%. LDP -1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM

  • The week's ETF movers - Gainers: GAZ +3.9%. OIL +3.7%. USO +3.4%. EWY +2.9%. XLU +2.3%. ETF...

    The week's ETF movers - Gainers: GAZ +3.9%. OIL +3.7%. USO +3.4%. EWY +2.9%. XLU +2.3%.
    ETF Losers: TAN -4.5%. VXX -3.2%. REMX -3.1%. PSLV -1.8%. GDXJ -1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM
  • FTR

    Frontier's (FTR +3.7%) has expanded the scope of its debt refinancing, much to the Street's...

    Frontier's (FTR +3.7%) has expanded the scope of its debt refinancing, much to the Street's approval. The telco is now including $831.7M worth of 8.25% senior notes due 2017 as part of its cash tender offers, and has expanded the size of its 2024 senior note offering to $750M from $500M. Nomura's Mike McCormack (previous) thinks the moves demonstrate Frontier's financial health. He estimates Frontier will generate $3.5B in free cash flow from 2014-2017, more than enough to handle dividend/debt maturity obligations of $3.15B.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM | 3 Comments
  • QCOM

    A U.S. district court in Florida has denied a motion from Qualcomm (QCOM +0.4%) to dismiss an...

    A U.S. district court in Florida has denied a motion from Qualcomm (QCOM +0.4%) to dismiss an infringement suit levied by ParkerVision (OTC:PRKR +4.6%). The motion relates to an amended indirect infringement complaint filed by ParkerVision last September; a motion by Qualcomm to dismiss ParkerVision's original complaint was granted in August. ParkerVision investors like the news, which comes shortly after the chipmaker boasted of the quality of its patent portfolio in a PR.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • HDSN

    Shares of Hudson Technologies (HDSN -19%) get slammed today after the EPA issued its final...

    Shares of Hudson Technologies (HDSN -19%) get slammed today after the EPA issued its final ruling on virgin HCFC allowances for 2013 and 2014, providing for virgin allowances of 63M pounds in 2013 and 51M pounds in 2014. The company stated that although the issuance of a final rule has provided certainty, it continues to believe that the aftermarket demand exceeds the total allowances and that reclaimed HCFC will bridge the supply and demand gap.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • PEIX

    Pacific Ethanol (PEIX -4.5%) says it is importing sorghum as well as buying the grain from...

    Pacific Ethanol (PEIX -4.5%) says it is importing sorghum as well as buying the grain from domestic sources as prices for corn, the primary feedstock for the U.S. ethanol industry, hovers near historic highs. Grain traders say rumors had circulated earlier this month that PEIX was buying sorghum from Argentina for import. (earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • GPT

    "Whether I give you the dollar and you go spend it or invest it, or I reinvest it for you, it's...

    "Whether I give you the dollar and you go spend it or invest it, or I reinvest it for you, it's still your dollar," says Gramercy Capital (GKK +7.1%) CEO Gordon DuGan. As Gramercy works to build up the recurring cash flows necessary to restore a payout, investors can be comforted by tasty capital gains. SA Pro author Chris DeMuth - a bull on the stock at half of today's level -  says things are going as planned.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 9 Comments
  • AEIS

    Advanced Energy (AEIS -4.7%) is downgraded to Underperform from Neutral at BAML following a...

    Advanced Energy (AEIS -4.7%) is downgraded to Underperform from Neutral at BAML following a 33% YTD rally. While the firm continues to foresee improving semiconductor fundamentals and continued growth in inverters, the AEIS margin expansion story is well understood and fully reflected in the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG +12.7%) has soared over the last 90 minutes of trading, apparently thanks to...

    Vringo (VRNG +12.7%) has soared over the last 90 minutes of trading, apparently thanks to speculation about a settlement with Microsoft. A letter dated March 27 from a law firm representing Vringo states Microsoft and Vringo are "discussing settlement." Vringo sued Microsoft in January, alleging infringement of its search IP.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 6 Comments
  • XONE

    3D printing plays trade higher following ExOne's (XONE +7.9%) market-pleasing Q4 results and...

    3D printing plays trade higher following ExOne's (XONE +7.9%) market-pleasing Q4 results and 2013 guidance. DDD +4.1%. SSYS +1.1%. OTCPK:DASTY +1.3%. CIMT +2%. FBR remains bullish on ExOne, and thinks the company is "at the cusp of transitioning to a higher-growth mode." "We like ExOne’s unique positioning in the 3D industry, with its binder jetting technology and ability to print in sand and metal at relatively fast speeds in addition to low costs."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • GILD

    Gilead Pharmaceuticals (GILD +3%) tacks on another gain today, adding to yesterday's +4% run on...

    Gilead Pharmaceuticals (GILD +3%) tacks on another gain today, adding to yesterday's +4% run on the back of yesterday's update on ION-1, a Phase 3 clinical trial evaluating a combination of sofosbuvir and ledipasvir with and without ribavirin for treating the hepatitis C virus infection. A review by the study's Data and Safety Monitoring Board concluded that the trial should continue without modification. ISI says the treatment could see sales of $6B or more during either 2014 or 2015.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • GTATQ

    GT Advanced (GTAT +10.7%) shoots higher after signing a deal to sell more polysilicon...

    GT Advanced (GTAT +10.7%) shoots higher after signing a deal to sell more polysilicon manufacturing equipment to Taiwan's Powertec. Powertec, which has already bought equipment from GT that's good for making 6K metric tons/year (MTA), plans to eventually boost its capacity to 27.5K MTA. Orders related to the new deal are expected to start in 2H14.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • EBAY

    eBay (EBAY +2.3%) will enable $300B worth of commerce in 2015 via Marketplaces, PayPal, and GSI,...

    eBay (EBAY +2.3%) will enable $300B worth of commerce in 2015 via Marketplaces, PayPal, and GSI, up from $175B in 2012, CEO John Donahoe predicts during the company's analyst day (webcast). That's going over well with the Street, as is a forecast Marketplaces' merchandise volume will rise to $110B in 2015 from $75B last year; JPMorgan has been expecting $101.9B. Aided by mobile, international, and local commerce growth, eBay expects Marketplaces to grow "at least" at e-commerce market rates, after years of underperforming.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • GME

    Shares of GameStop (GME +7.4%) come roaring back from negative territory, seemingly helped in...

    Shares of GameStop (GME +7.4%) come roaring back from negative territory, seemingly helped in part by a rousing performance by execs on the firm's conference call. Pointing to new gaming console launches from Sony and Microsoft, the company sees strong growth in 2014 and 2015. They also highlight data showing a higher percentage of the company's consumers expect to buy a Playstation 4 in the next 12 months than a smartphone or tablet. (webcast)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • HIMX

    Himax (HIMX +12.2%) soars to fresh highs after SA contributor Stock Reversals talks up the...

    Himax (HIMX +12.2%) soars to fresh highs after SA contributor Stock Reversals talks up the potential of its LCOS panels within head-mounted displays, including but not limited to Google Glass. The author notes shares trade at just 12x-13x 2013E EPS (at least they did going into today), and points to earnings call comments about Himax "working with several top tier customers to develop new head-mounted display products."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • TXI

    Texas Industries (TXI -4.3%) slips today in a bout of profit-taking on the back of an upbeat FQ3...

    Texas Industries (TXI -4.3%) slips today in a bout of profit-taking on the back of an upbeat FQ3 report earlier this morning. Net losses narrowed as total sales increased 16% Y/Y, and bottom line margins were boosted by a pickup in construction in Texas and California. Gross margin also improved to 8.7%, compared with a negative 1.5% a year earlier, as increased shipments reduced unit costs. But the stock is up over 29% since January, and investors appear inclined to take advantage of the good news to lock in some profits while they can.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • MOS

    Mosaic (MOS +1.5%) would have concerns about a potential takeover of Israel Chemicals by Potash...

    Mosaic (MOS +1.5%) would have concerns about a potential takeover of Israel Chemicals by Potash (POT), CEO Jim Prokopanko says in its earnings call. POT, which is attempting to gain majority control of ICL, is a partner with MOS and Agrium in Canpotex, the offshore selling agency for potash the three companies mine in western Canada.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • INSM

    Insmed Incorporated (INSM +2%) gains after the FDA grants orphan drug designation to Arikace, an...

    Insmed Incorporated (INSM +2%) gains after the FDA grants orphan drug designation to Arikace, an inhaler for treating infections caused by non-tuberculous mycobacteria. The company notes that there's currently no FDA-approved treatment for this particular NTM lung infection.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • TTM

    Shares of Tata Motors (TTM -3.5%) slip as estimates for the auto industry in India continue to...

    Shares of Tata Motors (TTM -3.5%) slip as estimates for the auto industry in India continue to drift lower. Inventories are already at six week levels with more automakers scheduled to increase capacity.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • EDAP

    Edap (EDAP +3.4%) gains after saying the FDA has given the thumbs-up on a pre-market approval...

    Edap (EDAP +3.4%) gains after saying the FDA has given the thumbs-up on a pre-market approval application for its Ablatherm Integrated Imaging HIFU device, a high-intensity utrasound treatment for low-risk, localized prostate cancer.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM | 3 Comments
  • EDAC

    Private equity firm MidOcean Partners makes a last-minute $18.25 per share counterbid for Edac...

    Private equity firm MidOcean Partners makes a last-minute $18.25 per share counterbid for Edac Technologies (EDAC +4.5%), valuing the aerospace and industrial-components maker at about $105M and trumping Monday's $17.75 per share deal made with Greenbriar affiliate GB Aero Engine. The proposal, being made through one of MidOcean's affiliates and with a large North American pension plan investment manager, represents a 23.2% premium to the average closing per share price of EDAC over the 30 trading days preceding the announcement of the deal with Greenbriar.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • DTEGY

    Shareholder advisory firm ISS comes out against T-Mobile USA's (OTCQX:DTEGY) merger with Metro...

    Shareholder advisory firm ISS comes out against T-Mobile USA's (OTCQX:DTEGY) merger with Metro PCS (PCS +3.3%), agreeing with those "greedy hedge funds" who argue MetroPCS shareholders deserve better terms. Analysts now expect a sweetened bid, and David Faber reports "there does seem to be a line of thinking at Deutsche Telekom (OTCQX:DTEGY), about whether they should raise their offer." However, he adds "sources close to D-Tel are genuine when telling me Germans are unsure whether to try to save [the MetroPCS] deal."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 2 Comments
  • CBI

    Chicago Bridge & Iron (CBI +5.4%) trades higher after issuing a mixed yet still bullish...

    Chicago Bridge & Iron (CBI +5.4%) trades higher after issuing a mixed yet still bullish forecast for FY13 at its Analyst/Investor Day presentation this morning. It now sees combined earnings coming in at $4 to $4.35 a share on revenue between $10.7B and $11.2B, while analysts were expecting $4 on $11.48B, respectively. The company also says its backlog stands at a whopping $27B, and forecasts new awards of $13B to $16B this year - driven by growing demand in its energy infrastructure segment - which is significantly higher than the $7.3B it received in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • CTIC

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC +12.5%) trades higher today after securing a loan agreement with...

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC +12.5%) trades higher today after securing a loan agreement with Hercules Technology Growth Capital for a senior secured term loan of up to $15M. The proceeds are intended to provide additional operating capital to advance Phase 3 clinical studies of pacritinib, its treatment for patients with myelofibrosis, and driving the adoption of Pixuvri in Europe .

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM | 1 Comment
  • APA

    Apache's (APA +1.5%) Australian subsidiary and its partners sign long-term sales and purchase...

    Apache's (APA +1.5%) Australian subsidiary and its partners sign long-term sales and purchase agreements with Japan's Chubu Electric for liquefied natural gas from the Chevron-operated (NYSE:CVX) Wheatstone project in Western Australia. The Wheatstone partners will supply Chubu with 1M metric tons/year of LNG for up to 20 years.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • CEMI

    Chembio Diagnostics (CEMI -3.8%) slips after pricing a public offering of 1.2M shares at $5, a...

    Chembio Diagnostics (CEMI -3.8%) slips after pricing a public offering of 1.2M shares at $5, a 2.9% discount to Wednesday's close. Net proceeds on the sale come to around $5.5M, for which the maker of diagnostic testing equipment maker plans to use the funds for business expansion and working capital. Prior to the offering, it's current float stood at about 8.09M shares. Craig-Hallum is the sole book-running manager.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • PVH

    PVH Corp. (PVH -4.1%) trades lower after beating profit estimates with its Q4 report (I, II) but...

    PVH Corp. (PVH -4.1%) trades lower after beating profit estimates with its Q4 report (I, II) but issuing guidance on the soft side. Retail analyst Rahul Sharma says despite the guidance cut the retailer is showing impressive QTD sales trends in North America and Europe.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • ONCY

    Oncolytics Biotech (NASDAQ:ONCY) +8.7% premarket after announcing positive results from a...

    Oncolytics Biotech (NASDAQ:ONCY) +8.7% premarket after announcing positive results from a midstage study of its lead product candidate Reolysin in treating squamous cell carcinoma of the lung. A sufficient number of responses in the first stage of the study were seen to proceed with enrollment in the second stage.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • RPRX

    Premarket gainers: RPRX +75%. CTIC +14%. ONCY +8%. EXM +7%. DECK +6%. XONE +6%. Losers: TWO -8%....

    Premarket gainers: RPRX +75%. CTIC +14%. ONCY +8%. EXM +7%. DECK +6%. XONE +6%.
    Losers: TWO -8%. FIVE -7%. GME -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • ACN

    More on Accenture: CFO Pamela Craig is resigning from the position, effective July 1. Finance...

    More on Accenture: CFO Pamela Craig is resigning from the position, effective July 1. Finance SVP David Rowland will replace her. FQ3 guidance is for revenue of $7.25B-$7.5B, below a $7.6B consensus. FY13 revenue growth is now expected to be "in the lower half" of a prior guidance range of 5%-8%; consensus is already at 5.1%. Adjusted FY13 EPS guidance of $4.24-$4.32, in-line with $4.26 consensus, maintained. New bookings were $9.1B in FQ2, +15% Y/Y. $31B-$34B in FY13 bookings still expected. $609M worth of buybacks. ACN -3% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • GME

    More on GameStop (NYSE:GME): The retailer doesn't have a lot of good news to report despite...

    More on GameStop (NYSE:GME): The retailer doesn't have a lot of good news to report despite beating earnings estimates. The first half of 2013 is expected to be "challenging" as GameStop waits out the release of Grand Theft Auto V and the launch of next-generation consoles in the back half. Same-store sales fell 4.6% during FQ4 and the company expects -6% to +1.5% comp sales for the new fiscal year.  FY2013 EPS guidance for $2.75-$3.15 stands below estimates. GME -5.7% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM
  • DECK

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK) are running higher in premarket trading, up 6%, with a...

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK) are running higher in premarket trading, up 6%, with a generous price target increase to $100 from Jefferies helping to boost sentiment. The firm thinks the sheepskin market will finally turn back into the retailer's favor to give margins some relief. With the stock a favorite of short sellers, today's action could get even more volatile.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM
  • GME

    Gamestop (NYSE:GME): Q4 EPS of $2.16 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $3.56B beats by $0.1B. Shares...

    Gamestop (NYSE:GME): Q4 EPS of $2.16 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $3.56B beats by $0.1B. Shares -5.6% Premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • AAL

    Shares of U.S. Airways (LCC) move up 2.5% in premarket trading after a bankruptcy judge approves...

    Shares of U.S. Airways (LCC) move up 2.5% in premarket trading after a bankruptcy judge approves the carrier's merger with American Airlines (AAMRQ.PK). The combined airline will be the largest in the U.S. with over 6.7K daily flights and revenue of close to $40B when the merger is completed sometimes during Q3. What to watch: Analysts project close to $1B in synergies will be created from the deal but a real wildcard in airline mergers lies behind the scenes where reservations systems frequently don't get along with each other so well.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • NKE

    Goldman Sachs picks up coverage on Nike (NYSE:NKE) again with a Buy rating and $70 price target....

    Goldman Sachs picks up coverage on Nike (NYSE:NKE) again with a Buy rating and $70 price target. The firm sees impressive 9% organic growth in FY14 for Nike and margin expansion over the next two years. NKE +1.4% premarket to $59.25.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM
  • BB

    More on BlackBerry (BBRY) FQ4 earnings: Co-founder Mike Lazaridis is retiring from the company,...

    More on BlackBerry (BBRY) FQ4 earnings: Co-founder Mike Lazaridis is retiring from the company, effective May 1. Company shipped 6M smartphones in Q4, including about 1M BB10 units. Maybe the most fascinating news: The firm sold 370K Playbooks. Shares +9.2% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:31 AM | 23 Comments
